Because the state conducts an open primary , voters may vote on the ballot of any party - you make your choice at the polls .
Because the state conducts an open primary , voters may vote on the ballot of any party - you make your choice at the polls .

So , once you pick a ballot , you have to stick with that same political party even if there is a runoff ( in other words , you ca n't cast a Republican ballot in the main primary but then vote in a Democratic runoff ) .
